Description:
OverviewThis position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.Provide subject matter expertise to NAVCENT N6 in support of unclassified, classified and SCI network hardware (Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems, Media Converters). Configure / troubleshoot cryptographic devices (e.g., KG-175, KG-250, KG-250X KG-175D, and KV7/SV-7) to includes carrying and managing cryptographic keying material (keymat) and associated devices as needed during travel and while at the assigned work locations. Conduct device scanning / patching / updating / remediation for all network devices and support the Inside plant for NSA Bahrain Building 260 and various other Government-owned buildings on NSA Bahrain or outlying annexes; this includes the movement of data boxes and troubleshooting / repair of fiber optic and copper cable infrastructure for network classifications ranging from UNCLASSIFIED to SCI. TS-SCI Clearance required.ResponsibilitiesMajor Job Activities: Configure, maintain and troubleshoot NAVCENT network hardware (Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems, Media Converters) and cryptographic devices.
Provide network device scanning / patching / updating / remediation for all network devices.
Provide monitoring, management, installation, upgrading, troubleshooting, and administration of the Government’s mobile communications / fly-away kits and OC12 devices and underlying infrastructure.
Support Terrestrial circuits – Several leased-line commercial circuits provide data connectivity between NSA Bahrain and Isa Air Base. This footprint includes several Optical Carrier 12 (OC12) transport routers and layer-two/three data switches at Isa Air Base.
Support and maintain 8 PACSTAR 400/4500 communications suites and (2) DISN Enterprise Classified Travel Kit Gateway (DECTK-GW) Secure Flyaway Kits (SFK).Material & Equipment Directly Used: Navy classified and unclassified C4ISR computer systems and ONE-NET.Working Environment: Candidate will work primarily in computer facilities at Naval commands in an office or computer equipment room environment. Work outside of normal work week hours will be required to participate in meetings, troubleshooting efforts, and installations or upgrades. Physical Activities: Personnel may be required to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time.  Individual must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. unassisted.
The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection of installed computer and network equipment.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications: BS in Information Technology (or equivalent technical degree) or 5+ years technical experience in related discipline required.
IAT Level II Certification (per DoD Inst 8750.1 and Navy guidance) required. CCNA-Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, CND or SSCP with IA and CE required. 
5+ years’ experience with Navy or DoD Networks (SIPRNET, NIPRNET, SCI).
5+ years’ experience with Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems, Media Converters.
5+ years’ experience Optical Carrier 12 (OC12) transport routers and layer-two / three data switches.
5+ years’ experience with Managing and transporting cryptographic equipment and keying material.
Active DoD TS-SCI Security Clearance.Experience / Skills: Configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting network hardware (Routers, Switches, Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems, Media Converters) and cryptographic devices.
Conducting network device scanning / patching / updating and remediation.
Provide monitoring, management, installation, upgrading, troubleshooting, and administration of the Government’s mobile communications / fly-away kits and OC12 devices and underlying infrastructure.
Knowledge of military C2 architectures required.
Must be able to communicate clearly both orally and in writing.
Must be able to communicate clearly with senior Navy / DoD officials and technical personnel.
Candidate must be able to provide training as needed.Supervisory / Budget Responsibilities:  N/AWe are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Vectrus is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.
